definition: to herd/to breed livestock/to govern (old)/government official (old)

sentences.english: The cowboy lassoed a calf which was beside the bush.
sentences.chinese: 牧童套住了一隻在灌木叢邊的小牛。

sentences.english: Once upon a time there was a very naughty shepherd boy.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，有一個非常頑皮的牧童。

sentences.english: Cheerful expression goatherd lifelike, seem to be specially to welcome us.
sentences.chinese: 牧童歡快的表情栩栩如生，好象是特意來歡迎我們的。

sentences.english: The brave cowboy is herding a flock of sheep to descend a slope.
sentences.chinese: 那位勇敢的牧童把一羣羊趕下山坡。

sentences.english: Lambs frisk and play, the shepherds pipe all day.
sentences.chinese: 羊羔歡躍喜洋洋，牧童整天笛聲揚。

sentences.english: The Oriental shepherd was always ahead of his sheep.
sentences.chinese: 在東方的曠野中，牧童總是走在羊羣前頭的。

sentences.english: On the hillside lay a cowboy.
The cowboy is blowing his flute all day long.
sentences.chinese: 牛背上牧童的短笛，這時候也成天嘹亮地響着。

sentences.english: The cowboy drove his sheep at the hillside.
sentences.chinese: 牧童把他的羊羣趕向山坡。

sentences.english: Zhangxian Dragon Boat Festival, cowboy mountain worship.
Chunxiang shepherd boy Cattle Road, Horseshoe wandering Zuixiang dream.
sentences.chinese: 牧童牛背春香路，遊子馬蹄夢醉鄉。

sentences.english: Just this moment a crowd of cowboys on the ox back are blowing their flutes sonore.
sentences.chinese: 牛背上牧童的短笛，這時候也成天在嘹亮地響。

sentences.english: A vaquero on a cattle ranch in Mato Grosso.
sentences.chinese: 馬託格羅索州一間牛場的牧童。

sentences.english: The young boy raised sheep far away form the village all by himself.
sentences.chinese: 在一個小山村裏住着一個小牧童。

definition: to tend a flock of sheep/to let sheep out to pasture/fig. to throw off the reins/to leave sb alone/acting freely and irresponsibly
soughing/whistling or rushing sound (of the wind in trees, the sea etc)
